A clause taken out of M
r
Bodeleys l
re
towching S
r
William Reade/

page.lettertext:
fol.76r
To a second l
re
of yo
r
Lps of
e 4
th
of this present, w
ch
I received
synce the former, w
th
one from
hir ma
tie
to
e Generall States
in
e
favo
r
of
S
r
William Reade
, I can re tur ne no present aunsware
not having delivered hir ma
t
l
re
, for
t there are no Deputies to
fournishe an Assemblie, nor no Apparance of any to mete a longe
tyme.: In w
ch
regard I have advised the messenger that brought
it to repaire againe sone for the avoyding of Charges And as
towching his suite I will do in tyme Convenient what is possible
for me and procure from
e States an answare in writing w
ch
I
will send unto yo
r
LL
, and likewise to S
r
William./ But to impart to
yo
r
LL
my private opyn
o
n I do ghesse by my Conference w
th
a
principall office in this place, for the Accompt
of the Countrie,
That howsoever S
r
W
m
Reade Claymeth great sommes of money
they will make such defalkations, as it semeth in the end they will
Conclude him in arrerages./ Martij 30 1593
